factoid: Prince Andrew was carried in and laid on a table that had just been cleared.
A dresser was washing down the table that had just been cleared.
Prince Andrew could not make out distinctly what was in the tent.
Pitiful groans came from all sides of the tent.
Prince Andrew experienced torturing pain in his thigh.
Prince Andrew experienced torturing pain in his stomach.
Prince Andrew experienced torturing pain in his back.
Prince Andrew saw a general impression of naked, bleeding human bodies filling the low tent.
Similar naked, bleeding bodies had filled the dirty pond beside the Smolénsk road on a hot August day a few weeks earlier.
The sight of the chair à canon had filled Prince Andrew with horror.
There were three operating tables in the tent.
Two of the operating tables were occupied.
Prince Andrew was placed on the third operating table.
Prince Andrew was left alone for a short time.
Prince Andrew witnessed what was happening on the other two operating tables.
On the nearest operating table sat a Tartar.
The Tartar was probably a Cossack.
The Tartar's uniform was thrown down beside him.
Four soldiers were holding the Tartar.
A spectacled doctor was cutting into the Tartar's muscular brown back.
The Tartar grunted "Ooh, ooh, ooh!".
The Tartar lifted his swarthy snub‑nosed face with high cheekbones.
The Tartar bared his white teeth.
The Tartar began to wriggle and twitch his body.
The Tartar uttered piercing, ringing, and prolonged yells.
On the other operating table many people were crowding around it.
A tall, well‑fed man lay on his back with his head thrown back on the other operating table.
The man's curly hair had a certain color.
The shape of the man's head seemed familiar to Prince Andrew.
Several dressers were pressing on the man's chest to hold him down.
The man's large, white, plump leg twitched rapidly with a feverish tremor.
The man was sobbing.
The man was choking convulsively.
Two doctors were silently working on the man's other, gory leg.
One of the doctors was pale and trembling.
The spectacled doctor finished with the Tartar and covered him with an overcoat.
The spectacled doctor came up to Prince Andrew and wiped his hands.
The doctor glanced at Prince Andrew's face.
The doctor quickly turned away from Prince Andrew's face.
The doctor cried angrily to the dressers, "Undress him! What are you waiting for?".
The dresser with sleeves rolled up began hastily to undo the buttons of Prince Andrew's clothes and undressed him.
Prince Andrew's earliest childhood recollections returned to his mind when the dresser undressed him.
The doctor bent down over Prince Andrew's wound.
The doctor felt the wound.
The doctor sighed deeply.
The doctor made a sign to someone.
Torturing pain in Prince Andrew's abdomen caused him to lose consciousness.
When Prince Andrew regained consciousness, splintered portions of his thighbone had been extracted.
When Prince Andrew regained consciousness, torn flesh had been cut away.
When Prince Andrew regained consciousness, the wound had been bandaged.
Water was being sprinkled on Prince Andrew's face.
As soon as Prince Andrew opened his eyes, the doctor bent over him.
The doctor kissed Prince Andrew silently on the lips.
The doctor hurried away after kissing Prince Andrew.
After enduring the sufferings, Prince Andrew enjoyed a blissful feeling he had not experienced for a long time.
All the best and happiest moments of Prince Andrew's life returned to his memory.
Prince Andrew's earliest childhood returned to his memory.
In Prince Andrew's earliest childhood he used to be undressed and put to bed.
In Prince Andrew's earliest childhood his nurse sang him to sleep.
In Prince Andrew's earliest childhood he buried his head in the pillow.
In Prince Andrew's earliest childhood he felt happy in the mere consciousness of life.
The doctors were busily engaged with the wounded man.
The shape of the wounded man's head seemed familiar to Prince Andrew.
The doctors were lifting the wounded man up.
The doctors were trying to quiet the wounded man.
The wounded man's frightened moans could be heard.
The moans were subdued by suffering and broken by sobs.
Hearing the wounded man's moans, Prince Andrew wanted to weep.
Prince Andrew felt like weeping childlike, kindly, and almost happy tears.
The wounded man was shown his amputated leg stained with clotted blood and with the boot still on.
The wounded man sobbed, "Oh! Oh, ooh!", like a woman.
The doctor who had been standing beside the wounded man prevented Prince Andrew from seeing the wounded man's face.
The doctor who had been standing beside the wounded man moved away.
Prince Andrew said to himself, "My God! What is this? Why is he here?".
